intro: Glochidion mehipitense, commonly known as the Malayan glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is a small tree or shrub native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits. Glochidion mehipitense is often found in lowland and hill forest areas, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
